refactor(platform): isolate all platform-specific code to platform layer

-Add V4L2 control ID, pixel format, and buffer size calculation APIs to
-platform abstraction layer. Replace all remaining platform preprocessor
-directives in adsd3500_sensor.cpp and buffer_processor.cpp with API calls.

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
refactor(platform): move all platform-specific logic to platform folder

- Add ON_TARGET define to consolidate platform checks across SDK
- Add platform APIs for MIPI/deskew config and media pipeline setup
- Replace platform string checks with getMipiOutputSpeed()/getDeskewEnabled() APIs
- Wrap RPI media configuration behind platform::configureMediaPipeline()
- Consolidate multiple platform ifdefs with single ON_TARGET in system_impl
- Make version methods return empty strings for non-NXP platforms

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:

- Remove unused CTRL_PACKET_SIZE define from adsd3500_sensor.cpp
- Update platform README to document actual unified implementation architecture

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
feat(sdk): add platform-based MIPI/deskew configuration

-Implement runtime platform detection for MIPI output speed and deskew settings.
-NVIDIA Jetson gets 2.5 Gbps + deskew enabled; NXP/RPi use hardware defaults.
-Fix platform_config.h.in CMake template spacing; exclude *.in from clang-format.

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
refactor(platform): rename PLATFORM_RESET_GPIO_NAME to PLATFORM_RESET_GPIO

Simplifies GPIO configuration naming across all platforms (NVIDIA/RPI/NXP).
PLATFORM_RESET_GPIO_PIN remains RPI-specific for debugfs pin lookup.
Also fixes CMake template substitution syntax in platform_config.h.in.

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
refactor(platform): centralize GPIO reset with configurable timing and cleanup

-Moved sensor reset from adsd3500_sensor.cpp to Platform::resetSensor() with platform-specific implementations. Added timing macros (PLATFORM_RESET_PULSE_US, PLATFORM_RESET_DELAY_US). Fixed GPIO sysfs paths for named/numeric GPIOs. Removed unused config variables and TargetSensorEnumerator dead code.
-Added NXP platform support and proper API documentation.

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
refactor(platform): centralize GPIO reset with configurable timing

Moved sensor reset logic to Platform::resetSensor() with RPI/NVIDIA/NXP implementations. Added timing macros (PLATFORM_RESET_PULSE_US, PLATFORM_RESET_DELAY_US) for configurable reset delays.
Fixed GPIO sysfs paths: numeric GPIOs use gpio%d prefix, named GPIOs omit prefix. Removed unused variables: PLATFORM_CAPABILITIES, PLATFORM_RESET_GPIO, PLATFORM_RESET_METHOD, PLATFORM_V4L2_CTRL_BASE.

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
refactor(platform): centralize GPIO reset and remove unused config variables

-Moved sensor reset logic from adsd3500_sensor.cpp to Platform::resetSensor() with RPI/NVIDIA/NXP implementations.
-Fixed GPIO sysfs paths: numeric GPIOs use gpio%d prefix, named GPIOs (e.g., PAC.00) omit prefix.
-Removed unused variables: PLATFORM_CAPABILITIES, PLATFORM_RESET_GPIO, PLATFORM_RESET_METHOD, PLATFORM_V4L2_CTRL_BASE.

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
fix(rpi): enable frame capture on Raspberry Pi 5

Fix V4L2 control IDs for RPI (use 0x9819d0-d7),
register reads in open() and interrupt handler, enable interrupts in platform
sensor enumerator, and implement GPIO34 reset for ADSD3500.

Signed-off-by: Subham Singh <Subham.Singh@analog.com>

- Fix ab_averaging=0 and depth_enable=1 for RPI dual ISP

- Add fsyncTrigger control support with dual register/V4L2 writes
- Fix macro redefinition warnings and remove unused variables

data.author: andrestraker
data.message:
fix: Address clang-tidy and clang-analyzer warnings

This commit resolves multiple static analysis warnings across the codebase:

Security & Best Practices:
- Replace insecure strncpy with bounds-checked memcpy in tofi_util.c
- Add virtual destructor to Frame class to properly handle polymorphic cleanup
- Replace C-style strncmp with C++ string::compare in sensor_enumerator_nvidia.cpp

Virtual Method Calls During Destruction:
- Use explicit scope resolution for virtual method calls in destructors:
  - OfflineDepthSensor: stopPlayback(), stopRecording()
  - Adsd3500Sensor: stop(), adsd3500_getInterruptandReset(),
    adsd3500_register_interrupt_callback()
- Add NOLINTNEXTLINE comments to suppress analyzer notes where appropriate

Code Quality:
- Remove dead code: unused status assignments in frame_handler_impl.cpp
- Remove unused variables:
  - buffer_processor.cpp: totalCaptureTime, captureTime, captureStart, captureEnd
  - frame_impl.cpp: total_captures lambda capture
- Remove unused constant: QUEUE_TIMEOUT in buffer_processor.cpp
- Replace all else-after-return patterns with if statements per LLVM style guide
- Extract numVideoDevs in destructor to improve null-safety analysis

Fixes clang-tidy llvm-* checks and clang-analyzer warnings.

data.author: andrestraker
data.message:
fix(adsd3500_sensor): Comprehensive security and stability hardening

Address 16 critical and high-priority issues affecting memory safety, resource
management, and error handling in the sensor driver.

Memory Safety & Buffer Management:
  - Fix destructor null check logic for array element validation
  - Add buffer null checks before munmap operations
  - Add buffer null check before mode change operations
  - Validate VideoDevs array allocation with nothrow and error handling
  - Prevent buffer re-queue failures in getFrame error paths

Resource Management & File Descriptors:
  - Prevent FD leak on repeated open() calls by closing old devices
  - Add comprehensive FD cleanup on device initialization failures (goto cleanup)
  - Add explicit FD validity checks after opening main and sub-devices
  - Validate FD validity before ioctl operations to prevent invalid syscalls

Device State & Error Handling:
  - Update device state (m_isOpen=false) on mode change failure
  - Remove early return that bypassed critical buffer initialization
  - Replace unhandled error returns with goto-based cleanup pattern
  - Add vector size validation to prevent std::out_of_range exceptions

Code Quality:
  - Remove unused ADI_DEBUG macro
  - Replace hardcoded magic number with ADSD3500_BURST_RESPONSE_HEADER_SIZE
  - Fix burst mode switch to return error instead of continuing
  - Fix typo "avaialable" -> "available" in logging
  - Update misleading comments to reflect actual code flow

Testing:
  - All changes verified to compile with zero errors
  - Consistent error handling patterns throughout device lifecycle
  - Multi-threaded pipeline safety improved with defensive checks

data.author: Subham Singh

Add stream validity check before writing frames to avoid race condition

is enabled.

data.author: Subham Singh
data.message:
fix(sdk): resolve heap corruption in ToFi buffer management for QMP modes

- Add member variables to store original ToFi context pointers from InitTofiCompute()
- Always save original pointers immediately after ToFi library initialization
- Implement consistent pointer restoration after each frame processing
- Fix buffer size calculation to always allocate full space for all components

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message: libaditof: Perfomed Clang-formatting

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Add 3 retry functionality and reduce Queue size

	* This commit is to reduce the queue size to 3, as
	  it pop the queue on each frame, more is not required.

	* Add 3 retry functionality in processBuffer() function
	  instead of returning BUSY.

	* Add stop thread flag while poping the FIFO.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Replace raw pointer with shared pointer

	* This commit is to remove raw pointer
	  and replace it with shared pointer.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Perform name conventions and optimization.

	* Renames variables for easier readability.

	* Optimizes the code like remove vecto and mutex,
	  change stopthread to be more efficient.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Done clang-formatting

	* Fix the clang-formatting

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Fix V4l2 Frame size, Remove debug logs

	* This commit is to remove hardcoded v4l2 frame
	  calculation and use actual width and height in bytes.

	* Update arguments of setVideoProperties with width
	  and height in bytes.

	* Remove debug logs.

	* Add function brief comments.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Changed frame handler stucture name to avoid conflicts.

	* changed frame structure name to Tofi_v4l2_buffer to avoid
	  confusion in code(frame struct is already used in SDK's other part)

	* Added small code optimizations.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Added FIFO and thread safe.

	* This commit is to add threadsafe and FIFO
	  implementation.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Stop threads before sending the stream off.

	* Stop the thread before sending stream off
	  to avoid capture error while closing the stream.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Updated memory allocation calculation and code

	* Recalculate tofibuffer memory.
	* Remove hardcoded frame.size.
	* Remove unused memory allocation.
	* Remove logs.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Update processqueue usage

	* This commit is to update processqueue usage by
	  Adding max limit to it.
	* process queue should not grow the memory
	* Added conditional checks in code.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Changed memory allocation calculation

	* This commit is to change memory calulation to allocate
	  less memory.

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Added memcpy instead of assign for capture thread.

	* This coomit is to replace the assign logc with memcpy
	  this will reduce the copy time of frame to buffer pool.

Signed-off-by: Kishan Kava <kishan.kava@analog.com>

data.author: Kishan Kava
data.message:
libaditof: Implement asynchronous frame capturing and processing

	Refactors 'BufferProcessor' to a concurrent pipeline for
	decoupled frame acquisition and TOFI computation, improving throughput.

	Functionality: Captures and processes frames asynchronously,
		       allowing non-blocking data retrieval.
		       Buffers raw and processed frames for smoother flow.

Signed-off-by: Kishan Kava <kishan.kava@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
use relative path to the cmake of the project

libaditof can be included as a submodule and its cmake will also be
included. Use CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR which will point to the cmake of
libaditof instead of the cmake of the project including libaditof (e.g.
ToF).

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
Include <sstream> as it is needed

Without this the build fails. Only when cmake option
'WITH_GLOG_DEPENDENCY' was set to OFF this error occured. Probably
because glog/logging.h was including <sstream> itself.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
Include unistd.h only on UNIX

Also fix the #else branch of #ifdef USE_GLOG. On the else branch some
other headers were being included but those headers are always needed so
take them out of the else branch.

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
examples/viewer: Fix not being able to playback more than 200 frames

Seems that when file size is large, several variables of type int will
overflow. This happens when recording 'lr-native' (1024x1024) and more
than 200 frames (205) to be precise.
Use size_t which should contain 8 bytes of unsinged integer. This should
handle situations with larger files.
Files can't be infinite large since viewer has a upper limit of 300
frames to record.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: rbudai
data.message:
buffer_processor: copy data buffer to user space

By passing the kernel space pointer to TOfiCompute decreases the processing time of the frame. If we copy it to user-space and after that process it, we can obtain a higher fps, and the DeInterleave function duration decreases from 145ms to 6ms, in case of QMP

Signed-off-by: rbudai <robert.budai@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
apps/server: Server should acquire the 2 frames before host asks frames

Doing so, we make sure we only send the already cached frames.
Otherwise, suppose the host asks for 10 frames, the first two frames
will be acquired slower that the rest 8 frames. This influences the FPS
measured on the host side.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk/network: Don't lock mutex on the lws callback

The issue was that sometimes (depends on how fast the lws callback gets
called) a deadlock (with 10 seconds timeout) would appear, making a
certain command to be send to server to timeout.

There is one thread (usually main thread) where SendCommand() calls are
being made. One the 1st things that SendCommand() does is to call
lws_callback_on_writable() which triggers (or schedules) the
callback_function() to be called. This doesn't happen instantly (could
take longer or right away). This callback is executed on another thread
(which is the thread where we execute call_lws_service() in a loop.
Now, getting back to the SendCommand(), which has just triggered the
callback to be called ASAP but then it locks the m_mutex and if it does
that before the callback_function() gets called, the callback will block
because it also try to lock the m_mutex (see case
LWS_CALLBACK_CLIENT_WRITABLE). Then SendCommand() waits for callback to
finish or until 10 seconds had passed away. Since callback is blocked,
SendCommand() will timeout.
This doesn't happend each time. The most frequent scenario is when
callback is called really quickly and has the chance to lock the m_mutex
first, then sends data to server while SendCommand() remains blocked
trying to lock the m_mutex and then remains blocked waiting for the
callback to end which might already happened.
Also, do the same for the recv_server_data().
These changes were here from the beginning. I am not sure about their
purpose and by removing them I can't see the drawbacks. At least not
yet.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.message:
sdk/network: Possible improvement: don't lock mutex so frequently

Only lock the mutex when attempting to modify a variable. Locking might
be a litte more expensive than reading a variable. But I haven't checked
though.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk/network: Avoid a deadlock situation when destroying Network

The scenario where deadlock occurs:
In NetworkSensorEnumerator we call searchSensors() which calls
Network::ServerConnect() which will spawn an independent thread (that
will run in a loop call_lws_service()). After spawing the thread,
ServerConnect() fails with a timeout error (waits 3 seconds). Sometimes
it timesout sometime it works. Perhaps network is slow and 3 seconds
timeout is not enough or perhaps there is another issue but not
important here. So, ServeConnect() fails and sets variable
Server_Connected to false. In parallel call_lws_serice() is executed and
sees that Server_Connected is false and exits, terminating the thread.
Then in NetworkSensorEnumerator we destroy the Network object, making
its destructor to be called. There, in that destructor, we wait for the
thead mentioned above to end (more specific, we wait that thread to
provide a signal through a condition variable). And the wait is going to
be forever since the thread no longer exists.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
network: Remove serializing flag. Reduce 1 frame copy on remote

Remove serializing flag. This flag was telling the remote whether the
message is wrapped in a protobuf message or is just a series of bytes.
The first byte of the message was storing the flag value. This
simplifies the server code.
Reduce one frame copy on remote by provoding the Network object with the
location where to put the incoming frame. This applies only when
expecting frame and not for protobuf messages. This seems to increase
the FPS by a couple of frames (depedens on how performant is the remote
PC).

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Filter the types of content comming from sensor when DC on target

Remove the "raw" and "conf" that are comming from sensor when we have
Depth Compute on target. This is because sensor will only send depth and
AB.
Also rearange the frame types tables to avoid extra memcpy. Sensor is
sending Depth+AB in a continous block of data that is being copied to
the Frame object which interally has also one block of data and
different pointers pointing to "depth", "ir", "xyz", etc.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

Use the 'depth compute is on NXP' flag to handle everything: send
request to target to initialize depth compute locally, handle the
incoming processed frames, apply the XYZ generation, skip initializing
depth compute on host.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: meet
data.message:
getFrame error should be reported to callee

Issue:
The API `requestFrame` is reporting success status `Status::OK` even if
internal API call `status = m_depthSensor->getFrame(frameDataLocation)`
is failed.

Fix:
Return proper error code to application layer instead of `tatus::OK`.

Signed-off-by: Meet Gandhi <meet.gandhi@einfochips.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
bindings/python: Fix the adsd3500 getter functions

In python we can't send an int or bool or double as a reference.
Therefore we need to make the getter to return the value we want to
read. So send a pair made from status of the call and the read value.
Client code will need to read the second item from the pair to get the
value.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Handle carefully when setting bool variable

On Windows I found the bool variable to be of size 1 byte. However the
adsd3500_read_cmd() will read 2 bytes. This caused a write outside the
memory area allocated for the bool. In my case the variable was
allocated on stack wich triggered a runtime error when
adsd3500_read_cmd() attempted to write outside the bool variable.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Make sure adsd3500_read_cmd overwrites the entire variable

adsd3500_read_cmd will read 4 bytes (or 2 uint16_t) and use these 4
bytes to overwrite a variable that is given. But if the variable is
wider (e.g. int, longlong, int64_t, etc.) then the rest of the most
significant bytes will remain the same. This can be a problem if the
variable is left uninitialized (thinking it will be set with a new value
anyway) since uninitialized variables have random values and most likely
the untouched bytes will be non-zero.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: rbudai
data.message:
ADIToFRecorder initial refactor

Function startRecordingRaw added in order to separate from the general
case. Directory creation also separated in different function for code
simplicity.
Added binary format checkbox for optional data logging. This included
a control variable passed from Viewer to Controller and to the Recorder
object
Save file format became generic for future additional format types
Linux file open bug fix, the Save file command did not allow the user
so far to enter a valid file name, hence the Recorder was not able to
open the file for save.

Signed-off-by: rbudai <robert.budai@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Fix order in which JBL settings are being sent to adsd3500

The issue was that JBL filter was always ON no matter how it was set in
the .ini file.
The fix is to set all JBL properties first and then enable/disable JBL
filter. It seems that setting the JBL filter size would also enable it.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
clangformatignore: Ignore external ADI dependencies

We're removing FSF files which are located in examples/data_collect/adi/FSF but CI job fails since it looks at the changes (lines of code that were both added and removed) and performs a formatting on them.
Since these FSF files were never formatted (most likely the CI job
didn't exist at the time they were added) the formatting fails.
So we tell clang-format to ignore them.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
examples/tof-viewer: Quick (dirty) fix to make playback work with 'raw'

The frame has an internal structure (that refers to what content exists:
depth, AB, etc. and the resolution for each of them).
The current implementation of the recording process doesn't save
anything about the frame structure. So when playback starts, we don't
know how to construct the frame.
The quick fix is to assume depth and AB has been recorded.
A full refactor is needed.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.message:
sdk: Make adsd3500 chose frame types based on available info

If we know both imager type and ccb version when in open() method,
choose the frame type.
Otherwise, wait until camera finds out the ccb version (by reading the
NVM) and the provides this information via setControl(). And only then
choose the frame types.

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk/common/adi: Add open source depth compute for xyz frames

Use the algorithm from examples/point_cloud.

This implementation is meant for cameras that already produce
depth frames (have the hardware capabilities to process raw frames).
This open source depth compute will use the depth frame to obtain
a xyz frame. And will not replace entirely the full depth compute library.

On systems where the full depth compute library is not available this
open source implementation can be used provided that camera already
produces depth frames.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
examples/tof-viewer: Don't wait for camera ready

1st reason to remove this:
It's not clear why this is required. The function that changes the mode is a blocking type function. Once it finishes the execution, the camera should be in the new mode.

2nd reason to remove this:
The function to wait for camera calls getFrame but at the same time there is a thread that also calls getFrame. This messes things up (especially depth compute) as neither depth compute nor geFrame are thread safe.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk/system_impl: Log the websockets version when searching for cameras

It's better to have it here rather than in the constructor, giving the
tof-viewer time to be ready to log. Ideally it shouldn't be here. Maybe
create a structure that contains all versions of all things.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Move printing SDK version from contructor of System to examples

Clients of SDK should have more flexibility to when to print the SDK
version. So don't rely on the constructor of class 'System' to print the
version.
In case of tof-viwer where the logging is rerouted to a window
that is part of the viewer, the logging of SDK version doesn't get
display as the viewer is not ready yet.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
cmake: fix multiple includes of version.h

This fixes error during linking. Error was multiple redefinitions of
functions from version.h.

This happens when more compilation units include version.h.
For example the error started to show when the header was included to
data_collect.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Fix inline function being called in other part of code

reflect8 is declared inline in it's .c file but also is being called by
other C++ class. For release builds the body of this function gets
inlined in it's .c file but for the C++ class the compiler won't know to
inline it. So the linker will complain that there is no implementation.
(LNK2019: unresolved external symbol reflect8 referenced in function
crcFast)

Signer-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

sensors (which are already opened for communication). So check if
client didn't hang up and cleanup sensors and start fresh.

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk/connections/network: Don't wait for inexisting thread to finish

If we construct a Camera object but we don't initialize it (this happens
when we just list all available cameras) but then we destroy it, then
the Network object never gets initialized (no thread gets created). Then
the problem occurs when the Network object gets destroyed and wait for
some internal threads to finish. These threads were never created so it
ends up waiting forever.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: TOFCMOS-48 Remove PCM selection from Viewer. TOFI-1879 Load viewer supported modes from file. These two are related. The best way to remove PCM and other modes is, for now, via the JSON file. It will be something like this: 'modes': 'qmp, mp, mp_pcm'

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: TOFCMOS-39 for Red color and blue color. TOFCMOS-36 remove generation of imgui.ini. TOFCMOS-35 display the SDK version in the UI title. TOFCMOS-33 Remove external PNGs in Viewer. TOFCMOS-34 Remove MainWindowTitle.txt. TOFCMOS-43 Remove unused 2MB vairable on ADIToFRecorder.h. TOFCMOS-25 Viewer crashes when FSF files are opened and frames viewed.

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Revert changes into the FrameImpl destructor. Disabled HSV GUI color map convention so that far is displayed as blue and near is displayed as red.

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Deleted cvui.h and guicon.h files. They don't seem to be used on our current viewer. Updated stb_image.h to version v2.27

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Fixing more logging issues: Now LOG(INFO) on ADIMainWindow.cpp can display Log information.

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Deleting guicon.h and guicon.cpp. Those files are not used.

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Disabled FSF playback due to memory leakage. These buffers need to be disposed each frame to avoid massive memory consumption.

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: The log functionality now creates a local folder in case is not already created and stores all log information saving it as log_yyyymmddhhmmss.txt format. Related to TOFI-1844

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Adding color to the Log severity. Information remains white, Warning is now Yellow, and Error is now Red.

data.author: Wilfrido Sierra
data.message: Fixing some LOG messages so that they are more meaningful. This fix is related to TOFI-1844.

data.author: Bogdan Togorean
data.message:
apps: uvc-app: uvc-gadget.cpp: Don't stop streaming if UVC buff has ERR flag set

If UVC dequed buffer has ERR flag set don't stop the stream and just
continue. It can be queued on the capture device as it is and it will be
discarded there.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Togorean <bogdan.togorean@analog.com>

data.author: Bogdan Togorean
data.message:
apps: uvc-app: uvc-gadget.cpp: Replace resolution with mode

Setting default resolution only on UVC video gadget is useless
and even creates problem if standalone UVC mode is used because
UVC video dev has the resolution set but the capture video device
does not. So remove -r parameter and use new -m parameter
that can set the camera mode at UVC app starting time.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Togorean <bogdan.togorean@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
apps/server: Handle timeout for 3.1 and 3.2.3 versions of Websockets

With websockets 3.1 we need to set timeout to something greater than
0 (can be 50 ms) otherwise the server will take 100% of the CPU time.
On 3.2.3 we know things are handled internally and we can safely pass
0 milliseconds.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
examples/aditof-demo: Fix memory leak by learing queue with frames

What was happening was that after clicking the stop button and then
click start again, the memory usage (on Windows) was increasing by 1.4
GB. And this could go on for each stop->start iteration.
The fix is to clear the queue with captured frames when stopping the
stream capture. Otherwise the next captuing will start with a large
queue (thinking it's empty) and appending new frames to that.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Bogdan Togorean
data.message:
sdk: camera_itof: Don't return error if EEPROM is not found

The usecase where no EEPROM chip is installed should be valid
and we should not fail the initialize() if EEPROM is not detected.
The only requirement is to have both CFG and CCB defined in
.json config if no EEPROM chip is installed on imager module.

data.author: Bogdan Togorean
data.message:
sdk: itof-camera: camera_itof.cpp: Add check for USEQ runnig state

If USEQ is initialized an in running or in idle state don't program
the CCB and CFG again. In order to modify the CCB or CFG loaded in
imager module a power cycle must be performed.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Togorean <bogdan.togorean@analog.com>

data.author: Bogdan Togorean
data.message:
sdk: cameras: Enable configuration loading by SDK

This commit enable loading of camera configuration from camera NVM
or locally defined .cfg file. Locally defined .cfg have priority and
should be defined in the config.json. If it is not defined the SDK
will parse cmaera module NVM memory and extract the cfg from there.

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Togorean <bogdan.togorean@analog.com>

data.author: Bogdan Togorean
data.message:
sdk: connections: adsd3100: Modify chip_config ctrl

Modify chip_config ctrl to get through V4L a block of
addr<->reg values and loop through in driver and not in SDK.
This way the number of control calls is greatly reduced and
FW flashing is speed up greatly.
Driver patches must be kept in sync for this functionality

Signed-off-by: Bogdan Togorean <bogdan.togorean@analog.com>

address is a pointer to an array.

desired.

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Close communication between NetworkDepthSensor only if opened

The NetworkDepthSensor instance can be destroyed before it has a change
to get opened. This happens when checking what sensors are available and
not doing anything with them. If it's not opened, don't send the hangup
signal to server (because things didn't get initialized to talk to
server yet).

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
apps/server: Keep alive the list of depth sensors

Otherwise, on first connect to server the list of sensors will be
filled and then destroyed. On second connect, a new list will be created
but findSensors() won't be called again thus leaving the list empty.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
examples/data_collect: Don't always connect to network

Setting ip to "" makes it non-empty since it contains no characters but
contains the null character that is used to point the end.
Also adding a [Default] to the docopt options makes the argument
args[--ip] to non-empty which makes the example believe that the IP was
set.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Add structure to define the frame captured by depth sensor

The new structure is for low level API. It is used to describe the frame
type that can be captured by the depth sensor and that can be
transmitted through various communication channels (MIPI, USB, Network).

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

sdk: Update the use of Frame::getData() in all cameras

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Change frame API to get data and details based on data type

Frames can hold multiple types of data within. For example, it could
hold depth data or IR data.
With these changes user can ask for the data that it is interested in
and since it will need to know the resolution, this is provided by
getDataDetails().

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Restucture the details that are provided for a frame

Now, multiple formats and their associtated type of data are described.
Add the mode the camera was in when the frame was acquired.
As a result, getDataDetails() needs to be added to the API of the Frame
in order to get information about just one of the data contained by the
frame.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>

data.author: Dan Nechita
data.message:
sdk: Add 'attributes' to a frame

Different cameras can stream different types of frames. Attributes can
be specific to a type of frame. Attributes are identified by name (string)
and have a value (also string).

This allows for keeping the same API for frames that are somehow
different but not fundamentally different.

Signed-off-by: Dan Nechita <dan.nechita@analog.com>
